GRAYSLAKE AREA PUBLIC LIBRARY DISTRICT Grayslake IL March 2005 to Present Manage and maintain the computers servers and network infrastructure of the library over four distinct networks Help and train our staff to use and understand their computing resources Evaluate the organizations technology use and needs to determine upgrades and procurement of hardware and software Perform data backups and disaster recovery operations Completely restructured the entire computing environment implementing the grayslakeinfo domain group policies and installed a corporate level email system Further divided and segregated the network into four distinct segments to enhance security of the LAN implementing two other domains in the public segments Plan coordinate and implement network security measures to protect data software and hardware Administer our Google GSuite cloud application suite Research new technologies by attending seminars reading trade articles or taking classes Implement new technologies as needed Implement and provide technical support for voice services and equipment such as private branch exchange voice mail system and telecom services Implemented major cost saving initiatives which has kept the IT department staffing levels minimal by reducing or eliminating support calls with selfcorrecting and error eliminating computer configurations Actively contributed to creating and implementing two long range plans Work with the management team to develop and interpret organizational goals policies and procedures Evaluate propose and expend the organizations overall budget and automation budget each fiscal year Substantially involved in three library expansion construction projects gaining experience in the process and procedures needed to successfully see a construction project through from conception to completion Oversaw successful fiber optic connectivity project from conception to completion coordinating three entities in the process Lead four large expenditure projects including research negotiations contracts and implementation Projects included complete replacement and upgrade of buildingwide HVAC control system replacement of telephone system and two rounds of copier replacement Solicited input from end users during the process and ensured appropriate training was provided Lead contributor to the conceptualization of the librarys vision of the proposed makerspace The Hub Designed the positions hired appropriate staff and led the team through the planning construction and organization successfully implementing this new service The Hub opened in June of 2018 Illinois Freedom of Information certified and one of three FOIA officers Desktop Administrator Computer Technician WAUKEGAN PUBLIC LIBRARY September 2000 to March 2005 Managed and maintained the computing infrastructure of the library Procured configured and deployed the computers for use in the library and on the book mobiles Supported and maintained the computing environment for the Lake County Literacy program housed at the library and the literacy satellite center Configured and deployed new network servers and network services Evaluated proposed and expended the IT budget each fiscal year Troubleshoot and corrected computer and network issues Trained staff and public on the use of their computers and software in informal workshops and classes Staffed the Computer Coach Reference desk daily to provide assistance and guidance of computer use to library users and staff Education BA SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE UNIVERSITY Manchester NH July 2021 AAS
